column4: Any command line junkies here? How do I use the output of a previous command as an argument in the current command?
Try using a pipe?  ls | nextcommand.

ok here's what I want. first I did "which gconftool" and the output was /usr/bin/gconftool .. next I want to do a "file" on that. So I could do file `which gconftool` but I don't want to type `which gconftool` again .. get what I am saying?
